result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chad Russell Salmon

records.addlTxt:
2:40 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Chad Russell Salmon appeared by phone.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson in court for Chad Russell Salmon.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Erickson is heard and Def. stands mute, "Not Guilty" plea entered. Clerk directed to enter a not guilty plea.
Jury status hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for December 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial on December 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury status hearing on December 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

10:29 AM Case called - appearances stated. 
Defendant Chad Russell Salmon appeared by phone.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson appeared by video for Chad Russell Salmon.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Erickson states def. is prepared to proceed to preliminary hearing.

1W - ANTHONY BERG -Sworn by Court
exam by Atty. Steiner
cross exam by Atty. Erickson

Atty Steiner moves for bind over
Atty. Erickson objects to bind over

Court finds probable cause to bind over for further proceedings.
Atty. Erickson requests another date for arraignment.
Arraignment scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

11:31 AM Defendant Chad Russell Salmon appeared by video.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson in court for Chad Russell Salmon.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Erickson is heard.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 23, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel - Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson

Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw.

1:30 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Chad Russell Salmon appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Charlotte M Wynes appeared by video for Chad Russell Salmon.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

BOND HEARING: 
State is heard on bond. State recommends an additional  $250.00 be added to his bond for a total of $500.00. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. 

Attorney Wynes is heard on bond. Requests a signature bond. 

Court orders an additional $250.00 be added to his bond for a total of 500.00. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. 

INITIAL APPEARANCE: 
Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Defendant states understanding.  Right to counsel is explained.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 7, 2022 at 11:15 am.

9:42 AM Case called - appearances stated. Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Chad Russell Salmon not in court. 

Court notes this case was scheduled to be heard yesterday, def. did not appear, court agreed to wait until the end of the day to issue a warrant  -Def. did not contact court  - case was called today.
Court issues bench warrant - to be held until further hearing
Bail/bond hearing on March 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

1:53 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Chad Russell Salmon not in court, Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

DA requests a warrant for failure to appear.  $250.00 bond out. 

Court orders a warrant for 22CF29 $250.00 bond.
